p: The sample was divided across counties in three metropolitan areas: Central Arizona (Maricopa County, n=205), Southern California (Los Angeles County, n=155 and Orange County, n=44), and Southeast Florida (Miami Dade County, n=98 and Broward County, n=103) ( Table 1). Approximately 10% (10.9%) of the overall sample was Black or African American, and over one-third (38.4%) was Hispanic. Slightly less than one-third of respondents (30.4%) reported having one or more chronic health conditions, one-quarter (23.2%) had pollen allergies, and slightly more than 10% had a disability (12.6%) and/or a mental health condition (10.5%). Democrats (including Democrat-leaning Independents) comprised the majority of this sample (63.8%), while nearly one-third (32.8%) were Republicans (including Republican-leaning Independents).
